utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Would you mind by starting to tell me what brought you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, absolutely. Uhm, I don't know, I've just been feeling a little feverish, uhm, and I also have a, a bit of a sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, when...

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just came in, I just came in to see what's going on, cause I was worried, you know, with covid going on, uhm, going everywhere.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Certainly, when did the, the sore throat start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Last night actually.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And uhm, have you had any, uhm, problems with swallowing, like food or liquids?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so. I just had breakfast this morning and no problems there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, any like, changes that, uhm, other symptoms that you've been having with the sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm just feeling a little feverish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: This morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, did you take your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't have a thermometer at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any, any cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about any, like red eyes or runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, neither of those.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had a headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and have you had any shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about any loss of taste or loss of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I don't, uh, yes, I said I was eating breakfast this morning, but it just tasted really bland.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so maybe loss of taste, so you feel like your nose is really or that you're really congested?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I guess yeah, now that I think about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and how has your appetite been?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's alright.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so you haven't had any cough or shortness of breath, but have you noticed any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you felt as though your hearts's been racing at all or, or beating out of your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been dizzy or lightheaded?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I'm often constipated but nothing new there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and then how about any muscle aches or, or body aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sort of, like I just, I found it really hard to get out of bed this morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. How has your energy been? Have you been, like really fatigued?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did, uh, you said the muscle ache started this morning, uhm, how, when did the fatigue start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'd say this morning as well, yesterday was just like a little tickle in my throat and I thought it would just go away you know, and I woke up this morning and I just felt horrible. And the sore throat was just worse and I felt feverish and tired and I felt really crappy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, and have you had any symptoms like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well yeah, I usually get a cold once a year in the fall. It does feel similar to that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: But I still wanted to be careful and come in, just in case.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: yeah, certainly. Have you had, have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have migraines.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you taking any medications regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, I'm not. It's not bad. I sometimes just take like, Advil whenever my headache's coming on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I smoke, uh, two or three a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you tried to quit?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, if at any point this is something that you wanted to talk about, we, we certainly could later.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, a glass at night with dinner.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you use any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been around anybody who's been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, oh, my, like my little granddaughter had, uhm, you know, they're always having a runny nose, right, the little ones.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Mhm.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: But no, nothing, nothing else. I've just been at home for the most part.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you traveled traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, uh, does your granddaughter go to daycare? Or is she in school?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: She, she does go to daycare, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and has there been anybody else around that, that's been sick that you're living with, or you see often?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I, I think, I don't think I asked this, but have you had any surgeries before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I had cataract surgery done.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the left, right eye or right eye?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Both actually, it runs in my family. We get it pretty early on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are there any other conditions that run in your family like heart conditions or cancer?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Diabetes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Diabetes, OK. And who had diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Lets see, my mom, my sister, my brother, yeah, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And just to, get to know you a little bit better as well. I was wondering if you could tell me a little bit about your living situation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, yeah, I live with uh, I live with my son and daughter and my grandson.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, and, uhm, OK, yeah, I think that's all I wanted to ask about today. Was there anything else that you wanted to tell me or maybe that I forgot to ask about?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so. Do you think I have covid?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's, it's certainly possible. It will be something we test for.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Although the symptoms that you're experiencing, with feeling or having a fever, sore throat, and not feeling well with the muscle aches and fatigue, uhm, its relatively non-specific, so as you mentioned, it could be something like the common cold, that you've experienced in the past, so we can't rule that out either at this time, but we will do some investigations including a nasal swab for covid and kind of go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, sounds good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: All right, we'll get that started.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
